sen.j: 江戸時代の学問で儒教の一派。
sen.e: Kogaku was an Edo-period school of thought espoused by Confucian scholars.
Kogaku was a learning in the Edo-period, and a group of Confucianism.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Kogaku was a learning in the Edo-period, and a group of Confucianism.
See below for an explanation of Kogaku.

sen.j: 特に聖学を指す場合がある。
sen.e: It is a term used especially frequently to describe Seigaku (religious studies).
It sometimes particularly refers to Seigaku (religious studies).
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: It sometimes particularly refers to Seigaku (religious studies).
Kogaku is another name for Kokugaku (national learning).
Kogaku is another name for Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature).
Kogaku is another name for Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature).

sen.j: 古学（こかく、聖学）は、山鹿素行が興した学問で、儒教の一派。
sen.e: Kogaku (or again Kokaku, and Seigaku) was a Confucian school of thought that was revived by Soko YAMAGA.
Kogaku (also referred to as Kokaku, and Seigaku) was a learning revived by Soko YAMAGA, and a group of Confucianism.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Kogaku (also referred to as Kokaku, and Seigaku) was a learning revived by Soko YAMAGA, and a group of Confucianism.

sen.j: 聖学、古義学、古文辞学の総称。
sen.e: It is a general term for Seigaku, Kogigaku (classical ethics) and Kobunjigaku (classical rhetoric).
It is a general term for Seigaku, Kogigaku (study of ancient principles) and Kobunjigaku (study of ancient rhetoric school).
sen.cmt: カッコ部分をそれぞれ修正しました。
sen.e: It is a general term for Seigaku, Kogigaku (study of ancient principles) and Kobunjigaku (study of ancient rhetoric school).

sen.j: 後世の解釈によらず、論語などの経典を直接実証的に研究する。
sen.e: Kogaku scholars did not rely on later commentaries and interpretations, instead going to the original sources like the Analects and so forth and carrying out empirical research directly.
Kogaku scholars studied directly and empirically those Buddhist scriptures such as Rongo (Analects of Confucius), without relying on the interpretations of later generations.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Kogaku scholars studied directly and empirically those Buddhist scriptures such as Rongo (Analects of Confucius), without relying on the interpretations of later generations.

sen.j: その実証的な研究態度は国学などに影響を及ぼした。
sen.e: The empirical research focus of Kogaku scholars had an impact on Kokugaku (national learning) and other fields.
Their empirical research attitude had an impact on Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature) and other fields.
sen.cmt: The→Their,focus of Kogaku scholars→attitude,カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Their empirical research attitude had an impact on Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature) and other fields.
